author: Not available

text.1: Het þa hyssa hwæne      hors forlætan,
text.10: Eac him wolde Eadric      his ealdre gelæstan,
text.100: Byrhtnoð mid beornum;      he mid bordum het
text.101: wyrcan þone wihagan,      and þæt werod healdan
text.102: fæste wið feondum.      þa wæs feohte neh,
text.103: tir æt getohte.      Wæs seo tid cumen
text.104: þæt þær fæge men      feallan sceoldon.
text.105: þær wearð hream ahafen,      hremmas wundon,
text.106: earn æses georn;      wæs on eorþan cyrm.
text.107: Hi leton þa of folman      feolhearde speru,
text.109: bogan wæron bysige,      bord ord onfeng.
text.11: frean to gefeohte,      ongan þa forð beran
text.110: Biter wæs se beaduræs,      beornas feollon
text.113: Byrhtnoðes mæg;      he mid billum wearð,
text.116: Gehyrde ic þæt Eadweard      anne sloge
text.117: swiðe mid his swurde,      swenges ne wyrnde,
text.118: þæt him æt fotum      feoll fæge cempa;
text.119: þæs him his ðeoden      þanc gesæde,
text.12: gar to guþe.      He hæfde god geþanc
text.120: þam burþene,      þa he byre hæfde.
text.123: hwa þær mid orde      ærost mihte
text.125: wigan mid wæpnum;      wæl feol on eorðan.
text.127: bæd þæt hyssa gehwylc      hogode to wige
text.128: þe on Denon wolde      dom gefeohtan.
text.129: Wod þa wiges heard,      wæpen up ahof,
text.13: þa hwile þe he mid handum      healdan mihte
text.130: bord to gebeorge,      and wið þæs beornes stop.
text.131: Eode swa anræd      eorl to þam ceorle,
text.133: Sende ða se særinc      suþerne gar,
text.135: he sceaf þa mid ðam scylde,      þæt se sceaft tobærst,
text.136: and þæt spere sprengde,      þæt hit sprang ongean.
text.137: Gegremod wearð se guðrinc;      he mid gare stang
text.138: wlancne wicing,      þe him þa wunde forgeaf.
text.139: Frod wæs se fyrdrinc;      he let his francan wadan
text.14: bord and bradswurd;      beot he gelæste
text.140: þurh ðæs hysses hals,      hand wisode
text.141: þæt he on þam færsceaðan      feorh geræhte.
text.143: þæt seo byrne tobærst;      he wæs on breostum wund
text.144: þurh ða hringlocan,      him æt heortan stod
text.145: ætterne ord.      Se eorl wæs þe bliþra,
text.146: hloh þa, modi man,      sæde metode þanc
text.147: ðæs dægweorces      þe him drihten forgeaf.
text.148: Forlet þa drenga sum      daroð of handa,
text.149: fleogan of folman,      þæt se to forð gewat
text.15: þa he ætforan his frean      feohtan sceolde.
text.151: Him be healfe stod      hyse unweaxen,
text.152: cniht on gecampe,      se full caflice
text.153: bræd of þam beorne      blodigne gar,
text.156: ord in gewod,      þæt se on eorþan læg
text.157: þe his þeoden ær      þearle geræhte.
text.158: Eode þa gesyrwed      secg to þam eorle;
text.159: he wolde þæs beornes      beagas gefecgan,
text.16: ða þær Byrhtnoð ongan      beornas trymian,
text.160: reaf and hringas      and gerenod swurd.
text.161: þa Byrhtnoð bræd      bill of sceðe,
text.162: brad and bruneccg,      and on þa byrnan sloh.
text.163: To raþe hine gelette      lidmanna sum,
text.164: þa he þæs eorles      earm amyrde.
text.165: Feoll þa to foldan      fealohilte swurd;
text.166: ne mihte he gehealdan      heardne mece,
text.167: wæpnes wealdan.      þa gyt þæt word gecwæð
text.170: ne mihte þa on fotum leng      fæste gestandan.
text.173: ealra þæra wynna      þe ic on worulde gebad.
text.174: Nu ic ah, milde metod,      mæste þearfe
text.175: þæt þu minum gaste      godes geunne,
text.176: þæt min sawul to ðe      siðian mote
text.178: mid friþe ferian.      Ic eom frymdi to þe
text.179: þæt hi helsceaðan      hynan ne moton."
text.18: hu hi sceoldon standan      and þone stede healdan,
text.181: and begen þa beornas      þe him big stodon,
text.183: ða onemn hyra frean      feorh gesealdon.
text.184: Hi bugon þa fram beaduwe      þe þær beon noldon.
text.185: þær wearð Oddan bearn      ærest on fleame,
text.186: Godric fram guþe,      and þone godan forlet
text.187: þe him mænigne oft      mear gesealde;
text.188: he gehleop þone eoh      þe ahte his hlaford,
text.189: on þam gerædum      þe hit riht ne wæs,
text.19: and bæd þæt hyra randas      rihte heoldon
text.190: and his broðru mid him      begen ærndon,
text.192: ac wendon fram þam wige      and þone wudu sohton,
text.193: flugon on þæt fæsten      and hyra feore burgon,
text.194: and manna ma      þonne hit ænig mæð wære,
text.195: gyf hi þa geearnunga      ealle gemundon
text.196: þe he him to duguþe      gedon hæfde.
text.197: Swa him Offa on dæg      ær asæde
text.198: on þam meþelstede,      þa he gemot hæfde,
text.20: fæste mid folman,      and ne forhtedon na.
text.201: þa wearð afeallen      þæs folces ealdor,
text.204: þa ðær wendon forð      wlance þegenas,
text.206: hi woldon þa ealle      oðer twega,
text.208: Swa hi bylde forð      bearn ælfrices,
text.21: þa he hæfde þæt folc      fægere getrymmed,
text.210: ælfwine þa cwæð,      he on ellen spræc:
text.211: "Gemunan þa mæla      þe we oft æt meodo spræcon,
text.212: þonne we on bence      beot ahofon,
text.213: hæleð on healle,      ymbe heard gewinn;
text.214: nu mæg cunnian      hwa cene sy.
text.215: Ic wylle mine æþelo      eallum gecyþan,
text.216: þæt ic wæs on Myrcon      miccles cynnes;
text.217: wæs min ealda fæder      Ealhelm haten,
text.219: Ne sceolon me on þære þeode      þegenas ætwitan
text.22: he lihte þa mid leodon      þær him leofost wæs,
text.220: þæt ic of ðisse fyrde      feran wille,
text.221: eard gesecan,      nu min ealdor ligeð
text.222: forheawen æt hilde.      Me is þæt hearma mæst;
text.223: he wæs ægðer min mæg      and min hlaford."
text.224: þa he forð eode,      fæhðe gemunde,
text.225: þæt he mid orde      anne geræhte
text.226: flotan on þam folce,      þæt se on foldan læg
text.227: forwegen mid his wæpne.      Ongan þa winas manian,
text.228: frynd and geferan,      þæt hi forð eodon.
text.23: þær he his heorðwerod      holdost wiste.
text.231: þegenas to þearfe,      nu ure þeoden lið,
text.232: eorl on eorðan.      Us is eallum þearf
text.234: wigan to wige,      þa hwile þe he wæpen mæge
text.236: gar and godswurd.      Us Godric hæfð,
text.238: Wende þæs formoni man,      þa he on meare rad,
text.239: on wlancan þam wicge,      þæt wære hit ure hlaford;
text.24: þa stod on stæðe,      stiðlice clypode
text.240: forþan wearð her on felda      folc totwæmed,
text.242: þæt he her swa manigne      man aflymde!"
text.243: Leofsunu gemælde      and his linde ahof,
text.244: bord to gebeorge;      he þam beorne oncwæð:
text.245: "Ic þæt gehate,      þæt ic heonon nelle
text.246: fleon fotes trym,      ac wille furðor gan,
text.248: Ne þurfon me embe Sturmere      stedefæste hælæð
text.249: wordum ætwitan,      nu min wine gecranc,
text.251: wende fram wige,      ac me sceal wæpen niman,
text.252: ord and iren."      He ful yrre wod,
text.256: bæd þæt beorna gehwylc      Byrhtnoð wrece:
text.257: "Ne mæg na wandian      se þe wrecan þenceð
text.258: frean on folce,      ne for feore murnan."
text.259: þa hi forð eodon,      feores hi ne rohton;
text.262: þæt hi moston gewrecan      hyra winedrihten
text.263: and on hyra feondum      fyl gewyrcan.
text.264: Him se gysel ongan      geornlice fylstan;
text.265: he wæs on Norðhymbron      heardes cynnes,
text.266: Ecglafes bearn,      him wæs æscferð nama.
text.267: He ne wandode na      æt þam wigplegan,
text.268: ac he fysde forð      flan genehe;
text.269: hwilon he on bord sceat,      hwilon beorn tæsde,
text.27: ærænde to þam eorle,      þær he on ofre stod:
text.270: æfre embe stunde      he sealde sume wunde,
text.271: þa hwile ðe he wæpna      wealdan moste.
text.272: þa gyt on orde stod      Eadweard se langa,
text.274: þæt he nolde fleogan      fotmæl landes,
text.275: ofer bæc bugan,      þa his betera leg.
text.276: He bræc þone bordweall      and wið þa beornas feaht,
text.277: oðþæt he his sincgyfan      on þam sæmannum
text.278: wurðlice wrec,      ær he on wæle lege.
text.281: Sibyrhtes broðor      and swiðe mænig oþer
text.282: clufon cellod bord,      cene hi weredon;
text.283: bærst bordes lærig,      and seo byrne sang
text.284: gryreleoða sum.      þa æt guðe sloh
text.285: Offa þone sælidan,      þæt he on eorðan feoll,
text.286: and ðær Gaddes mæg      grund gesohte.
text.287: Raðe wearð æt hilde      Offa forheawen;
text.288: he hæfde ðeah geforþod      þæt he his frean gehet,
text.289: swa he beotode ær      wið his beahgifan
text.29: heton ðe secgan      þæt þu most sendan raðe
text.290: þæt hi sceoldon begen      on burh ridan,
text.291: hale to hame,      oððe on here crincgan,
text.294: ða wearð borda gebræc.      Brimmen wodon,
text.298: he wæs on geþrange      hyra þreora bana,
text.299: ær him Wigelines bearn      on þam wæle læge.
text.3: hicgan to handum      and to hige godum.
text.30: beagas wið gebeorge;      and eow betere is
text.300: þær wæs stið gemot;      stodon fæste
text.302: wundum werige.      Wæl feol on eorþan.
text.306: þæt hi þær æt ðearfe      þolian sceoldon,
text.31: þæt ge þisne garræs      mid gafole forgyldon,
text.311: "Hige sceal þe heardra,      heorte þe cenre,
text.312: mod sceal þe mare,      þe ure mægen lytlað.
text.313: Her lið ure ealdor      eall forheawen,
text.314: god on greote.      A mæg gnornian
text.315: se ðe nu fram þis wigplegan      wendan þenceð.
text.316: Ic eom frod feores;      fram ic ne wille,
text.317: ac ic me be healfe      minum hlaforde,
text.318: be swa leofan men,      licgan þence."
text.319: Swa hi æþelgares bearn      ealle bylde,
text.320: Godric to guþe.      Oft he gar forlet,
text.322: swa he on þam folce      fyrmest eode,
text.323: heow and hynde,      oðþæt he on hilde gecranc.
text.324: Næs þæt na se Godric      þe ða guðe forbeah
text.33: Ne þurfe we us spillan,      gif ge spedaþ to þam;
text.34: we willað wið þam golde      grið fæstnian.
text.35: Gyf þu þat gerædest,      þe her ricost eart,
text.36: þæt þu þine leoda      lysan wille,
text.37: syllan sæmannum      on hyra sylfra dom
text.38: feoh wið freode,      and niman frið æt us,
text.39: we willaþ mid þam sceattum      us to scype gangan,
text.40: on flot feran,      and eow friþes healdan."
text.43: yrre and anræd      ageaf him andsware:
text.44: "Gehyrst þu, sælida,      hwæt þis folc segeð?
text.45: Hi willað eow to gafole      garas syllan,
text.47: þa heregeatu      þe eow æt hilde ne deah.
text.49: sege þinum leodum      miccle laþre spell,
text.5: þæt se eorl nolde      yrhðo geþolian,
text.50: þæt her stynt unforcuð      eorl mid his werode,
text.54: hæþene æt hilde.      To heanlic me þinceð
text.55: þæt ge mid urum sceattum      to scype gangon
text.56: unbefohtene,      nu ge þus feor hider
text.58: Ne sceole ge swa softe      sinc gegangan;
text.59: us sceal ord and ecg      ær geseman,
text.6: he let him þa of handon      leofne fleogan
text.61: Het þa bord beran,      beornas gangan,
text.62: þæt hi on þam easteðe      ealle stodon.
text.63: Ne mihte þær for wætere      werod to þam oðrum;
text.64: þær com flowende      flod æfter ebban,
text.65: lucon lagustreamas.      To lang hit him þuhte,
text.67: Hi þær Pantan stream      mid prasse bestodon,
text.69: Ne mihte hyra ænig      oþrum derian,
text.7: hafoc wið þæs holtes,      and to þære hilde stop;
text.70: buton hwa þurh flanes flyht      fyl gename.
text.71: Se flod ut gewat;      þa flotan stodon gearowe,
text.73: Het þa hæleða hleo      healdan þa bricge
text.74: wigan wigheardne,      se wæs haten Wulfstan,
text.75: cafne mid his cynne,      þæt wæs Ceolan sunu,
text.76: þe ðone forman man      mid his francan ofsceat
text.77: þe þær baldlicost      on þa bricge stop.
text.78: þær stodon mid Wulfstane      wigan unforhte,
text.8: be þam man mihte oncnawan      þæt se cniht nolde
text.80: þa noldon æt þam forda      fleam gewyrcan,
text.81: ac hi fæstlice      wið ða fynd weredon,
text.82: þa hwile þe hi wæpna      wealdan moston.
text.83: þa hi þæt ongeaton      and georne gesawon
text.84: þæt hi þær bricgweardas      bitere fundon,
text.87: ofer þone ford faran,      feþan lædan.
text.88: ða se eorl ongan      for his ofermode
text.89: alyfan landes to fela      laþere ðeode.
text.9: wacian æt þam wige,      þa he to wæpnum feng.
text.90: Ongan ceallian þa      ofer cald wæter
text.92: "Nu eow is gerymed,      gað ricene to us,
text.93: guman to guþe;      god ana wat
text.95: Wodon þa wælwulfas      (for wætere ne murnon),

source: The Complete Corpus of Anglo-Saxon Poetry
